column5: We have a group of 8 crossing the US border into Canada @ the Thousand Islands in New York. In an attempt to control costs, we're taking 2 SUV's. One of the SUV's we're using belongs to an individual not going along on the trip. Are there any special credentials we need outside of his current registration and current proof of insurance (both US & Canada)? Of all the years and trips to Canada's great north, I've never had this situation. Thanks for the guidance and suggestions. Best.
I think your best bet would be to contact that border crossing and ask them what they would require.
Our group researched just this question last year. We brought a notarized letter from the owner stating it was with his permission. Oh, and they never asked. lol
I would second Terwalleye's suggestion, along with the proof of insurance, etc.

Our group ran into this situation this year. Here is the link for ezbordercrossinghttp://www.ezbordercrossing.com/the-...rowed-vehicle/There is a sample copy of the permission slip that should be filled out by the owner.Have a great trip
And if the agents ask "where is the vehicle plated?" Don't say "on the bumper." You will get the detailed search!
To each and every one of you who responded, I appreciate you taking the time and sharing your info. I'll update the thread upon our return. Best.
